cellKey 0.17.2
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • Introduction to the cellKey-Package
  • Changelog

Create perturbation parameters for count variables

ck_params_cnts.Rd

This function allows to generate required perturbation parameters that are used to perturb count variables.

ck_params_cnts(D, V, js = 0, pstay = NULL, optim = 1, mono = TRUE,
  epsilon = 0.0000001)

Arguments

D

perturbation parameter for maximum perturbation (scalar or vector)
V

perturbation parameter for variance (scalar)
js

treshold value for blocking of small frequencies (i.e. there won't occur positive target frequencies below the treshold value)
pstay

optional parameter to set
optim

optimization parameter: 1 standard approach (default)
mono

(logical) vector specifying optimization parameter for monotony condition
epsilon

(double)

Value

an object suitable as input to cellkey_pkg() for the perturbation of counts and frequencies.

See also

This function uses functionality from package ptable (https://github.com/sdcTools/ptable), expecially ptable::pt_create_pParams() and ptable::pt_create_pTable(). More detailed information on the parameters is available from the respective help-pages of these functions.

Examples

x <- ck_create_testdata()

# create some 0/1 variables that should be perturbed later
x[, cnt_females := ifelse(sex == "male", 0, 1)]
#>       urbrur roof walls water electcon relat    sex        age hhcivil expend
#>    1:      2    4     3     3        1     1   male age_group3       2   9093
#>    2:      2    4     3     3        1     2 female age_group3       2   2734
#>    3:      2    4     3     3        1     3   male age_group1       1   2652
#>    4:      2    4     3     3        1     3   male age_group1       1   1807
#>    5:      2    4     2     3        1     1   male age_group4       2    671
#>   ---                                                                        
#> 4576:      2    4     3     4        1     2 female age_group3       2   3696
#> 4577:      2    4     3     4        1     3   male age_group1       1    282
#> 4578:      2    4     3     4        1     3   male age_group1       1    840
#> 4579:      2    4     3     4        1     3 female age_group1       1   6258
#> 4580:      2    4     3     4        1     3   male age_group1       1   7019
#>       income savings ori_hid sampling_weight household_weights cnt_females

#>    4:   7960     870       1              34          25.00000           0
#>    5:   9030      20       2              99          16.66667           0

#> 4579:   3880     294    1000              55          16.66667           1
#> 4580:   4830     911    1000              93          16.66667           0
x[, cnt_males := ifelse(sex == "male", 1, 0)]

x[, cnt_highincome := ifelse(income >= 9000, 1, 0)]

#>    1:   5780      12       1              85          25.00000           0

#>    4:   7960     870       1              34          25.00000           0
#>    5:   9030      20       2              99          16.66667           0
#>   ---                                                                     
#> 4576:   7900     278    1000              42          16.66667           1
#> 4577:   1420     987    1000              40          16.66667           0
#> 4578:   8900     684    1000              20          16.66667           0
#> 4579:   3880     294    1000              55          16.66667           1
#> 4580:   4830     911    1000              93          16.66667           0
#>       cnt_males cnt_highincome
#>    1:         1              0
#>    2:         0              0
#>    3:         1              0
#>    4:         1              0
#>    5:         1              1

#> 4576:         0              0
#> 4577:         1              0
#> 4578:         1              0
#> 4579:         0              0
#> 4580:         1              0

# create record keys
x$rkey <- ck_generate_rkeys(dat = x)

# define required inputs

# hierarchy with some bogus codes
d_sex <- hier_create(root = "Total", nodes = c("male", "female"))
d_sex <- hier_add(d_sex, root = "female", "f")
d_sex <- hier_add(d_sex, root = "male", "m")

d_age <- hier_create(root = "Total", nodes = paste0("age_group", 1:6))
d_age <- hier_add(d_age, root = "age_group1", "ag1a")
d_age <- hier_add(d_age, root = "age_group2", "ag2a")

# create a named list
dims <- list(sex = d_sex, age = d_age)
w <- "sampling_weight"
countvars <- c("cnt_females", "cnt_males", "cnt_highincome")
rkey <- "rkey"

# perturbation parameters for count variables
params_cnts <- ck_params_cnts(
  D = 5,
  V = 3,
  js = 2,
  pstay = 0.5,
  optim = 1,
  mono = TRUE
)

# define the cell key object
tab <- ck_setup(
  x = x,
  rkey = 5,
  dims = dims,
  w = w,
  countvars = countvars,
  params_cnts = params_cnts
)

# show some information about this table instance
print(tab) # identical with tab$print()
#> ── Table Information ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
#> ✔ 45 cells in 2 dimensions ('sex', 'age')
#> ✔ weights: yes
#> ── Tabulated / Perturbed countvars ─────────────────────────────────────────────
#> ☐ 'total'
#> ☐ 'cnt_females'
#> ☐ 'cnt_males'
#> ☐ 'cnt_highincome'

# perturb a single variable
tab$perturb(v = "total")
#> Count variable 'total' was perturbed.

# modify the perturbation parameters
# create alternative perturbation parameters
params_cnts_alt <- ck_params_cnts(
  D = 8,
  V = 3,
  js = 2,
  pstay = 0.5,
  optim = 1,
  mono = TRUE
)
# we creplace the current parameters with the alternatives
# they will be used from now on
tab$params_cnts(params_cnts_alt)
#> Perturbation parameters for count variables were modified.

# multiple variables can be perturbed as well
tab$perturb(v = c("cnt_males", "cnt_highincome"))
#> Count variable 'cnt_males' was perturbed.
#> Count variable 'cnt_highincome' was perturbed.

# return results (weighted and unweighted)
tab$freqtab(v = c("total", "cnt_males"))
#>        sex        age     vname  uwc     wc puwc        pwc

# write to a file "outtab.csv" (.csv is automatically added to the path)

# NOT RUN {
tab$freqtab(v = c("total", "cnt_males"), path = "outtab")
# }

# only weighted and perturbed weighted counts
tab$freqtab(v = c("total", "cnt_males"), type = "weighted")
#>        sex        age     vname     wc        pwc
#>  1:  Total      Total     total 276667 4641.40764
#>  2:  Total age_group1     total 119983 2026.93601
#>  3:  Total       ag1a     total 119983 2026.93601

# utility measures for a count variable
tab$measures_cnts(v = "total", exclude_zeros = TRUE)
#> $overview
#>    noise cnt        pct
#> 1:    -4   6 0.13333333
#> 2:    -3   2 0.04444444
#> 3:    -2   2 0.04444444
#> 4:    -1   4 0.08888889
#> 5:     0  18 0.40000000
#> 6:     1   4 0.08888889
#> 7:     2   7 0.15555556
#> 8:     3   2 0.04444444
#> 
#> $measures
#>       what    d1    d2    d3
#>  1:    Min 0.000 0.000 0.000
#>  2:    Q10 0.000 0.000 0.000
#>  3:    Q20 0.000 0.000 0.000
#>  4:    Q30 0.000 0.000 0.000

#>  6:   Mean 1.378 0.047 0.080
#>  7: Median 1.000 0.002 0.021

#>  9:    Q70 2.000 0.002 0.034
#> 10:    Q80 3.000 0.005 0.066
#> 11:    Q90 4.000 0.107 0.238
#> 12:    Q95 4.000 0.333 0.449
#> 13:    Q99 4.000 0.571 0.671
#> 14:    Max 4.000 0.571 0.671
#>

# modifications for perturbed count variables
tab$mod_cnts()
#>        sex        age row_nr pert    ckey       countvar
#>   1: Total      Total     62    1 0.75966          total
#>   2: Total age_group1     58   -3 0.07863          total
